timey.controller.model

Class DatabaseConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • timey.controller.model.DatabaseConnection

  • public class DatabaseConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Project: TimeY-WimeY-GUI

    Packages: timey.controller.model

    File: DatabaseConnection.java

    last update: 27.02.2015

    Time: 19:46:27

    Description:

    This class represents the Database Connection for the Main App and uses it's functions to get the data from the database and provide it for the Views.

    Copyright (c) 2015 by Rene Kremer

    Version:
    0.6
    Author:
    Rene Kremer

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseConnection

        public DatabaseConnection(java.lang.String rhost,
                          int rport,
                          int lport,
                          java.lang.String sshUser,
                          java.lang.String sshPassword,
                          java.lang.String dbUser,
                          java.lang.String dbPassword,
                          java.lang.String dbName)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        rhost - is the remote host of the database
        rport - is the remote port of the database
        lport - is the local port where the ssh connection shall be forwarded
        sshUser - is the user which accesses the remote host.
        sshPassword - is the password of the ssh user
        dbUser - is the user of the database
        dbPassword - is the password of the database user
        dbName - is the database name

                                                        java.lang.String idTo,
                                                        int userID)
        Gets the dates from the database and creates data objects for the observable list of the view
        Parameters:
        idFrom - is the id for the start date
        idTo - is the id for the end date
        userID - is the user id for whom the dates shall be viewed
        Returns:
        a list of dates

      • handleEditTime

        public boolean handleEditTime(Time time,
                              int userID,
                              java.lang.String startTime,
                              java.lang.String endTime,
                              java.lang.String totalTime,
                              java.lang.String note,
                              int calendarID,
                              int categoryID)
        Executes the query for updating a time in the database
        Parameters:
        time - is the time object which shall be updated in the database
        userID - is the id of the user
        startTime - is the new start time for the time object
        endTime - is the new end time for the time object
        totalTime - is the new total time for the time object
        note - is the new note for the time object
        calendarID - is the id of the date which the time is assigned to
        categoryID - is the id of the category assigned to the time
        Returns:
        true if the time is updated, false if not

      • handleRemoveCategory

        public void handleRemoveCategory(java.lang.String selected,
                                 int userID)
        Executes the query for removing a category from the database
        Parameters:
        selected - is the selected category
        userID - is the id of the user whom the category is assigned to

      • handleEditCategory

        public boolean handleEditCategory(java.lang.String newCategoryName,
                                  int userID,
                                  java.lang.String oldCategoryName)
        Executes the query for updating a category in the database
        Parameters:
        newCategoryName - is the new name for the category
        userID - is the user id whom the category is assigned to
        oldCategoryName - is the old name of the category
        Returns:
        true if database is updated, false if not

                              java.lang.String event,
                              int userID,
                              int calendarID)
        Executes the query for editing a date in the database
        Parameters:
        holidayFlag - is the new holiday flag for the date
        event - is the new event for the date
        userID - is the id of the user
        calendarID - is the id of the date
        Returns:
        true if the date is updated, false if not

      • handlePlanHoliday

        public boolean handlePlanHoliday(java.lang.String idFrom,
                                 java.lang.String idTo,
                                 int userID,
                                 boolean isHoliday)
        Executes the query for updating the holiday flag of many entries of dates
        Parameters:
        idFrom - is the id of the start date
        idTo - is the id of the end date
        userID - is the id of the user which dates shall be updated
        isHoliday - a boolean for checking the entered flag in the view
        Returns:
        true if database is updated, false if not

        Parameters:

        idTo - is the end date
        userID - is the id of the user for whom the categories shall be analyzed
